result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alicia Perez Aponte

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Alicia Marta Perez Aponte appeared by video.  Attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal appeared by video for Alicia Marta Perez Aponte.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for pretrial conference. 
Defense counsel has received discovery and an offer from the state.  Defense requests resolution date. Case adjourned to Branch 30.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Alicia Perez Aponte appeared by video.  Attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal appeared by video for Alicia Perez Aponte.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference.
Defense counsel informed the Court that the defendant has a pending felony matter 22CT629 assigned to Branch 15 that should be set in Branch 30 to track this case.
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 30.
This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Status conference scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Alicia Perez Aponte in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Sarah Mackenzie Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for calendar call. DEFENDANT APPEARS. Court cancelled stayed bench warrant. 
Defense requests adjournment due to client's medical issues.
Case adjourned.  Status conference scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal in court.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for status.  No appearance by the defendant.  Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed until the next court date.  Case adjourned to Br. 30.  Calendar call scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered bench warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Alicia Perez Aponte in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Navjot Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Alicia Perez Aponte appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in court for pre-trial conference. Defense recently appointed and requests discovery and and offer be sent. Defense also requests warrant be vacated. 
Court deputy confirms defendant has been booked. Court orders warrant withdrawn and matter adjourned for status. Case remains calendared in Branch 30.  Status conference scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Defendant Alicia Perez Aponte not in court.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failed to appear for their book and release dated on 05/25/2022.   Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued REMAND TO COMMISSIONER. Court took no action as to bail.

Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.
DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON (5/25/2022). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with B.W. and J.G.
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

ADDRESS INFO for Alicia Perez Aponte
Current: 6855 W Kathleen, Franklin, WI 53132   (Effective: 05-23-2022)
Prior: 5564 South Kirkwood Avenue, Cudahy, WI 53110

Defendant Alicia Perez Aponte in court.  Paul Leonard Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 30 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/23/2022@2:00p
